Austin Rivers recorded a career-high 41-point performance on Sunday, the second-most points by a Rockets reserve (Mike Dunleavy had 48 in 1980).

The Rockets are the fourth team in league history to have four different players score 40+ points in a game during one season:

1969-70 Bullets (Mike Davis, Kevin Loughery, Jack Marin, and Earl Monroe)
1988-89 Suns (Tom Chambers, Armen Gilliam, Eddie Johnson, and Kevin Johnson)
2007-08 Nuggets (Carmelo Anthony, Allen Iverson, Linas Kleiza, and J.R. Smith)
2019-20 Rockets (James Harden, Russell Westbrook, Eric Gordon, and Austin Rivers)
